bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: wounds and injuries of the upper extremities
wounds and injuries of the elbow joint
anchylosis of elbow from sabre cut

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms
checked OCR; added minimal mark-up for personal names, place names, and dates

body.p: CASE 1738.—Private A. Dubrieul, Co. K, 1st New York, was wounded at Antietam, September 17, 1862. Surgeon J. H. Robinson, U. S. V., reported his admission to the Patent Office Hospital, December 24, 1862, "with anchylosis of the right elbow, resulting from a sabre cut," and the soldier's discharge from service January 15, 1863. Not a pensioner.
